MATLAB.name: MATLAB
MATLAB.description: Environment assists users in generating and submitting MATLAB jobs. This environment uses matlabsubmit as the submission tool
MATLAB.author: Marinus Pennings

tamulauncher.name: tamulauncher
tamulauncher.description: Tool to run a large number of sequential or multi-threaded commands in a single job
tamulauncher.author: Marinus Pennings

Generic.name: Generic
Generic.description: This env is used to generate batch files for the Slurm scheduler. The form contains most of the common Slurm parameters and an element to add a module. The env is very general and should work on any cluster running Slurm
Generic.author: Marinus Pennings

AlphaFold.name: AlphaFold
AlphaFold.description: This env allows researchers to generate and submit AlphaFold workflows. It can generate both AlphaFold2 and AlphaFold3 jobs.
AlphaFold.author: Marinus Pennings

LAMMPS.name: LAMMPS
LAMMPS.description: This EXPERIMENTAL LAMMPS environment automatically generates a LAMMPS job by analyzing the LAMMPS input file. It will provide the researcher a list of accelerator strategies and LAMMMPS modules compatible with the input file. This environment is currently only available for the TAMU ACES cluster.
LAMMPS.author: Richard Lawrence

Parabricks.name: Parabricks
Parabricks.description: This environment allows researchers to run Parabricks through a graphical interface. Env is available on ACES and Grace.
Parabricks.author: Owen Schillaci, Victor Valdez

Python.name: Python
Python.description: Sets up Python environment for use on all TAMU clusters. This environment should be able to be used on non-TAMU clusters with few modifications. This environment uses ModuLair to manage virtual envs.

DronaPrimer.name: DronaPrimer
DronaPrimer.description: Training environment used by online training session 'Introduction to the Drona Workflow Engine' on the ACES cluster.
